intro: Echidnopsis angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved echidnopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white, blooming during the warmer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
